comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content:
Photographer Charles Kerry was also an early Australian skiing and winter sports enthusiast, and the PHM Tyrrell Collection includes a number of his pics taken in the NSW snowfields. Just going on the snow skis which we see here strapped to the rear vehicle, this might be a pic of a party of enthusiasts en route to Kiandra or perhaps Mt Kosciuszko. My guess is that the date is ca. 1907-1914. At about this time one commercial operator ran tourist cars from Jindabyne to the snowfields, though it's unclear whether that's what we see here.

Come on petrol heads! What are they? My non-expert's guess is that the rear vehicle might be a 1907 Peugeot...but it also looks a bit like a later model Mercedes Simplex Phaeton (ca.1905), or even one of the 1905 Benz models. The one in front looks like a larger version of the same make.

To view this pic in its magnificence, zoom in at the Persistent url.
